Title: Collections
Description: This shows the collections included in the store but not displayed in the sidebar

Title: What's New
Description: This collection shows the latest learning solutions added to the store.

Title: Sales Associate
Description: Responsible for identifying, developing and closing new business opportunities with Nokia Products, Solutions, and Services. Engages with customer on the Nokia story; positions the Nokia solution; and proactively manages the relationship on behalf the Partner Company and Nokia.

Title: Sales Engineer Specialist
Description: Supports the sales engagement technically; positions Nokia products and solutions to the customer; provides technical information on Nokia products and solutions to the customer; obtains customer requirements and translates into a customer specific solution design and/or Nokia offer; provides supports demos; participates in creation and presentation of offer based on customer requirements; provides recommendation of training and technical support to ensure best customer experience; utilizes tools and resources to support the engagement and order placement; and, submits orders to Nokia.

Title: Sales Engineer Professional
Description: Building on SE Specialist skills, this person additionally provides technical “vision” which can include intense white boarding sessions with the customer’s technical decision makers; provides expertise in analyzing client requirements, in conjunction with the client’s current network and system capabilities, and ensures technical solutions will accomplish the client's objectives; manage client proof of concept (POC) initiatives, which can require involvement of additional resources, and setup and delivery of the POC; acts as a bridge between the client, delivery resources and project management; owns the proposed solution, transitions the build / implementation to the delivery team; remains engaged with the client and returns as a “thought leader” for the next opportunity.

Title: Field Technician
Description: Installation/commissioning of new products; field maintenance including hardware replacements under the direction of Tech Support L1/L2; Nokia; or a 3rd party.

Title: Network Integration Engineer
Description: Implement the design in the customer’s network;  perform necessary configurations; establish network connectivity between the network elements; develop and conduct testing plans and procedures based upon system design requirements.  Plan, execute, and manage migration or replacement activities including decommissioning obsolete equipment.

Title: Level 1 Technical Support
Description: Resolves service tickets on settings, alarms, and configuration issues

Title: Level 2 Technical Support
Description: Builds on Level 1. Level 2 resolves more complex service tickets including troubleshooting.

Title: My Collection
Description: Description of my collection

Title: Cloud Datacenter Interconnect
Description: Enterprises need the ability to grow computing power and storage capacity while controlling costs. Cloud solutions offer the ability to outsource certain functions through virtualized resources while retaining others internally, allowing an enterprise to match business needs and budget. Cloud solutions are built by interconnecting data centers; commonly called Data Center Interconnect (DCI). Learn more about DCI so you can participate as enterprises continue to increase spending on DCI.

Title: Selling Nokia in the Defense Market
Description:
At the end of this course, you should be able to:

-Identify the best Nokia opportunities to pursue in the Defense market,

-Know who to contact to begin the conversation in the Defense market.

Title: Optical Transport Security: Layer 1 Security with Nokia 1830
Description: Current events have focused on highly publicized security breaches across many industries and governments around the world. The costs are real in terms of lost revenue, interruption of vital services, loss of customer assets, and information. Worse is the loss of confidence. Effective security includes more than data encryption, it includes multiple mechanisms to guard against data theft and network interruption. Optical Transport Partners will learn of the many competitive advantages of the Nokia 1830 PSS and how they can monetize these advantages to grow their business.

Title: Oil & Gas Pipeline Solution
Description: Digital oil and gas field transformation is already underway as energy consumption worldwide is expected to grow 48% until 2040. Oil and Gas companies continue to invest for exploration, extraction and transportation via pipelines regardless of the economic environment. Nokia IP, Optical and Microwave partners are well-positioned for success with Nokia solutions for key requirements in the Oil and Gas sector: Mobility and Onsite Communication; Automation; Security Cloud Services; and Data Analytics.

Title: Cloud DCI and Layer 1 Security
Description: This webinar will provide information on two use cases for Nokia’s 1830 PSS: Cloud DCI and Layer 1 security. Cloud DCI is an optical transport application that helps enterprises connect their data centers for workload virtualization and cloud adoption. Nokia helps enterprises build a solution matched to their needs, in private, virtual private or public cloud implementations. Layer 1 security shows how in-flight data can be protected from theft or intrusion through technologies including AES-256 encryption with strong keys, and optical intrusion detection.

Title: Selling into Airports and Air Traffic Control
Description:
Nokia has been addressing the need for mission critical infrastructure for transport customers for decades.

In this session we focus on air transport.

After an introduction about the airtransport communication market we will explore how to position our solutions in this segment, a segment which is present in every country and every major city.

We will show how the same products which address the mission critical needs of rail, utilities and other key customers are ideally suited to address challenges such as “ageing networking infrastructure in many air traffic control organizations or network modernization and harmonization of airports”.

As a good introduction to the specific challenges and Nokia solutions for air transport, the course targets sales, management and presales profiles primarily but is also recommended for any partner employee wishing to get up to speed on this segment and its specifics.

Title: Selling to Railways
Description: Globally there is a massive population shift from rural areas to urban areas. Due to this massive shift, transportation projects are underway to balance the need to move the population from point A to point B while reducing the carbon footprint and emissions. Rail projects are expected to grow 2-7% globally as a result of this change. Rail operators know they need to offer new services to their riders which present opportunities. Safety is always paramount which determines how some things can be done. In addition to the need for existing rail operators to offer new services, there are many new opportunities all over the world for mass transit, light rails and high speed lines where Nokia partners can sell a Nokia solution that can help rail operators to ensure safe, on-time and connected journeys.

Title: How to Position and Sell Communication Transformation
Description: This course provides an understanding of the challenges and requirements of a Power Utility looking to transform their communications network.   This training is designed to enable the learner to ... - Identify problem areas that encourage utilities to consider transforming their network. - Select indicators of suitable sales opportunities within this market. - Identify the minimum set of equipment required by the Nokia solution to support utility operations in a typical substation.

Title: How to Position and Sell Distribution Automation
Description: This course provides an understanding of the many new opportunities to position and sell Nokia's award winning products.

Title: How to Position and Sell Utility Broadband
Description: This course provides an understanding of the challenges and requirements of a Power Utility looking to update their communications network to broadband.

Title: Power Utilities 101
Description: Selling to Power Utilities Sessions is designed to present the “first and best” sales play into the Power Utilities market, based on the Alcatel-Lucent Sales Playbook. Session 1 addresses the Market, Customers and the Opportunities in the power utilities market. The discussion then moves to how to target the right business challenges and the Alcatel-Lucent solutions designed to meet these challenges, focused on the distribution segment of this market. The session concludes with an overview of Session 2 – “Getting Ready to Sell the Alcatel-Lucent Solution.”

Title: Network Solution for Legacy SCADA
Description: Driven by TDM sunset in telecommunications industry, utilities, transport, and mining are either starting to investigate or plan or migrate their legacy mission-critical grid applications such as SCADA to a new packet-based network. Migrating legacy SCADA traffic requires the new packet-based network to connect to legacy interface like RS-232/V.24 and 4-wire E&M used in legacy SCADA system, transport SCADA traffic with deterministic quality of service, resiliency and security; as well as accommodate the unique multi-drop nature of SCADA communications protocol. This session explores a network architecture based on IP/MPLS, a prevalent packet technology used in mission-critical network, to address these challenges at once.

Title: Powering up the Partner
Description: Powering up the Partner webcasts bring subject matter experts on the topics that are important to partners: product updates, partner tools, and industry news. You pick your topics. New webcasts will be added frequently.

Title: Nokia.com Status and Invoice Order Tools For Global Partners
Description:
Today’s webast will contain an overview of the Nokia Order Status/Invoice Services extranet tools for partners/customers not located in the US. An overview of both the Order Status Query functions and Invoice Status Query functions will be presented. The extranet tools presented contain the information direct from the Nokia order processing system with a one day batch cycle delay. After attending today’s session each participant will have the ability to track order status direct within the extranet tool

Click here for Guide

Title: Learning More About Segments and Solutions Sales Training
Description: You are invited to join Partner Learning Leads for NokiaEDU, for Rev Up: Segment & Solutions. In this live webcast, find out about Segment & Solutions training modules that are short, instructive and packed with helpful information for your Company. A Q& A segment will be included in this webinar. In addition to our main topic, you are encouraged to ask about The Learning Store, related training, MyPLE and Nokia Certification. Rev Up: Segment & Solutions is free of charge – sign up today!

Title: Product Support Portal Overview
Description: John will cover key highlights of the Product Support Portal and support collateral that is available through the search engine. The use of search refinement and filter sets will also be covered.

Title: Nokia.Com Order and Invoice Status Tools Overview for US Partners
Description: Today’s webcast will contain an overview of the Nokia North America Order Status/Order Invoice Services extranet tool for US customers/partners only. The extranet tools presented contain the information direct from the Nokia order processing system with a one day batch cycle delay. After attending today’s session each participant will have the ability to track order status direct within the extranet tool.

Title: Co-Marketing Tool
Description: The Nokia Co-Marketing Platform – Enabling Growth with Integrated, Co-Branded Marketing and Lead Generation The Nokia Co-Marketing Platform enables our partners to create, customize, deliver and track fully integrated ,co-branded marketing and lead generation campaigns. This tool can help extend Nokia partner’s reach into new markets and increase business with existing customers . In this session we will discuss the features and functionality of the tool and how best it can be used to promote Nokia products and solutions and generate leads.

Title: Mission Critical Network for Industries and Public Sector
Description: This webcast will introduce you to the Nokia mission-critical WAN solution and cover key customer cases across different verticals. Customers in industries and public sector rely on secure, reliable and flexible mission-critical networks to enable operational technology and IT/corporate services. Nokia has proven experience and is committed to these markets, including products and features tailored for industry applications. The IP/MPLS and Packet Optical solutions are well positioned to capture opportunities such as new network deployment, TDM to packet network migration, and private WAN refresh.

Title: Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Demand!
Description: Join this webcast to learn about Nokia’s SME On-Demand offerings and how to access them. SME On-Demand is an open approach to optional Partner Learning that is available to every partner employee. You can benefit from the expertise and knowledge of Nokia Subject Matter Experts on topics that appeal to you. Certification Training continues to be assigned by NokiaEDU.

Title: Nokia Partner Portal Access Management Training
Description: Join this live Nokia Partner Portal Access Management Training with Beatriz Rios-Mckee as she guides you step-by-step on the process to add, change or remove employee access to the Nokia Partner Portal. You will also learn how to request access to additional resources such as Configurators, Coop, and Order Management and how to run reports.

Title: Network Solution for Legacy SCADA
Description: Driven by TDM sunset in telecommunications industry, utilities, transport, and mining are either starting to investigate or plan or migrate their legacy mission-critical grid applications such as SCADA to a new packet-based network. Migrating legacy SCADA traffic requires the new packet-based network to connect to legacy interface like RS-232/V.24 and 4-wire E&M used in legacy SCADA system, transport SCADA traffic with deterministic quality of service, resiliency and security; as well as accommodate the unique multi-drop nature of SCADA communications protocol. This session explores a network architecture based on IP/MPLS, a prevalent packet technology used in mission-critical network, to address these challenges at once.

Title: Cloud DCI and Layer 1 Security
Description: This webinar will provide information on two use cases for Nokia’s 1830 PSS: Cloud DCI and Layer 1 security. Cloud DCI is an optical transport application that helps enterprises connect their data centers for workload virtualization and cloud adoption. Nokia helps enterprises build a solution matched to their needs, in private, virtual private or public cloud implementations. Layer 1 security shows how in-flight data can be protected from theft or intrusion through technologies including AES-256 encryption with strong keys, and optical intrusion detection.

Title: Enhance Business Performance With Nokia's Passive Optical Lan
Description: Nokia’s Passive Optical LAN solution leverages widely deployed fiber technology to provide a new approach to LAN connectivity. A POL deployment offers a future-proof investment in fiber that provides advantages today and scales to support growing bandwidth needs for tomorrow. POL can address a wide array of applications, providing partners with opportunities to position complementary products and services.

Title: Introduction to CSOD, Nokia's New Learning Platform
Description: Nokia is moving to a new learning platform that will simplify access to required and optional learning. Join this session, led by our Partner Learning Leads, for a demonstration of the new platform and the improvements it will bring to Partner training.

Title: The New Partner Prime!
Description: Click here for guide

Title: Where to Find Partner Pricing
Description:
Learn Where To Find Partner Pricing: a detailed walk-through showing where to find pricing for all the technologies on the Partner Portal.

Click here for guide.

Title: Introducing Your Intuitive Tool to View the Size of the Market Accessible to You.
Description:
Larger partners will often evolve their operations over time extending their operations from a single segment in their home market to a multi-country, multi-segment operation. The step by step evolution of such partners will very much be based on business considerations, comparing additional revenue potential with the additional effort. When considering such evolutions, Nokia has seen recurring requests to get access to “revenue data” to help validate each step in this evolution. To meet such requests, Nokia has developed a tool specifically designed to support this step by step partner evolution. This highly intuitive tool allows a partner to enter any combination of markets and segments and will provide a view of the size of their market across the different technology areas. The session consists of three parts

• A user training to introduce any interested parties to the use of the intuitive tool and the different outputs made accessible

 • A number of recurring usage scenarios based on experience with partners who have been given access to previous versions of the tool

• Background on the source of the data used for the tool and field experience A tool highly recommended for any partner looking to verifying the potential of existing coverage and looking to extending their coverage

Title: Segment Sales Training
Description: The training in this section will focus on the industry segments.

Title: Elective Training
Description: Additional courses to learn more about each technology. You may take one or more courses out of any of these lists.

Title: Service Desk Clerk
Description: The Service Desk Clerk is the "voice to the customer" within the Partner's Tech Support Help Desk. This person interacts with each customer calling in to collect all necessary information to provide the best experience for both the Partner and Nokia. The information captured by this person allows the appropriate Technical Support team to resolve an incident without having to repeatedly contact the customer for additional information.

Title: Services Sales
Description: The Services Sales Associate is responsible for selling Nokia services products.

Title: Why Sell Training to your Customers?
Description: This course (# TBU00075W) outlines the benefits training can bring to our partner customer’s business and to our partner's business, explains how our partners can capture new sales opportunities, and describes the Nokia’s learning solution offer.

Title: Airscale Wi-Fi Sales Associate
Description: The courses included in this curriculum focus on Nokia's relationship with their Partners, Key to Selling Nokia products, and the Airscale Wi-Fi product portfolio.
More information:
• TBU00071W Nokia and Partners - Opportunities Together
  • TBU31159W GPP Deal Registration Training for Partners
  • TMO00432W Nokia Airscale Wi-Fi Sales training
  • TBU00249W Protecting your customer with Nokia Maintenance Services

Title: Selling Maintenance to Your Customer
Description:
This course is designed to help Partners know the value of Nokia maintenance services to their customers and prospects.

Course outline:

  • How a Maintenance contract protects your customer
  • Nokia Maintenance portfolio
  • Understanding Nokia added values
  • In closing

Title: 4000 IP Interconnect Solution
Description: Buckle Up, This is Going to be Fast: introducing  400G IP. Watch video to see 400G IP line card in action.

Title: Analyst Sterling Perrin Interviews Steve Vogelsang
Description:
The Network Services Platform is purpose built to leverage Carrier SDN technologies and bridges the gap between service provisioning and network engineering. The NSP allows operators to provision services in seconds, cut development time and costs by over 50%, and increase revenue-generating traffic. See the interview between HeavyReading Analyst Sterling Perrin and Alcatel-Lucent's IPRT CTO Steve Vogelsang.

For more information, updates and useful links, please visit: www.alcatel-lucent.com/products/network-­services-platform

Title: Computing a Path to more Profits with Bell Labs Self-Tuned Adaptive Routing
Description: Compute a Path to More Profits with Alcatel-Lucent. Run a balanced and elastic IP routing infrastructure using the Bell Labs Self-Tuned Adaptive Routing (STAR) algorithm. Bell Labs STAR helps you deliver on-demand services quickly, cost-effectively and with efficient use of network resources

Title: Gigabit Express Animation
Description: "Gigabit Express", a solution to help municipalities and local broadband providers in the United States accelerate the creation of new Gigabit communities.

Title: History of Missed Opportunities
Description: Here's a collection of missed business opportunities from the Light Bulb to the Car to the PC. Now, don't miss out on Fiber for your Cable business.

Title: Light Up The Fiber
Description: Nokia powers some of the largest and most advanced broadband networks in the world. We help broadband providers and communities deliver gigabit services to people like Granny and Sophie - so they can enjoy all the benefits of a digital society

Title: Micro-Nodes: Fire Proof, Water Proof, Sophie Proof
Description: Our new micro-nodes are designed to survive the many perils of the city....but will they survive Sophie?

Title: Network Services Platform: Carrier SDN For the On-Demand Network
Description: Be dynamic in your service delivery. See how our Network Services Platform can help you transform your network services for an on-demand world. A unified approach to automation and control of IP/optical networks.

Title: VPN Designed for Cloud
Description:
Nuage Networks Virtualized Network Services (VNS) is a complementary service to your existing IP and Carrier Ethernet (CE) VPN services. However unlike those VPN services, Nuage Networks VNS was specifically developed to serve enterprises that are adopting a cloud-based IT consumption model.

Nuage Networks VNS aligns the network service to the needs of the enterprise and provides the flexibility to deliver an unconstrained network experience that matches the dynamic cloud environment.

Traditional VPN services are tightly connected to a dedicated network infrastructure. Nuage Networks VNS is based on an overlay model that uses any IP network to provide connectivity between sites, including your existing VPN, fixed broadband or mobile broadband.

This gives your customers maximum flexibility and the option to choose from available access/last-mile technologies including copper, fiber or wireless.

Description: Communication is critical to success in business and life. Concerned about an upcoming interview? Anxious about being asked to give your thoughts during a meeting? Fearful about needing to provide critical feedback in the moment? (This video is a TED Talk video)

Title: Nokia's New Maintenance Offerings for Partners
Description: The focus of the Webcast is to provide an overview of the 2017 Partner Maintenance offers, including their accreditation requirements, partner assessment process and discount structure. Click here for Guide.

Title: Global Partner Co-op Program 2017
Description: Yvonne Locke and PUTP presents "Global Partner Co-op Program 2017". Click here for Guide.

Title: Press Releases and Success Stories for Nokia Partners
Description: Nokia is a globally recognized brand, and as a company Nokia is very protective of its brand and how it is used. Nokia also highly values its partners as an important channel to the market. This session will go over the framework Nokia has put in place to guide communications around key milestones in the partner relationship, from announcing that a particular company has joined the Nokia Global Partner Program, to the introduction of new products or entry into new markets, to customer successes. We will explore how these guidelines can simplify the communications process, and ensure that both Nokia and the partner mutually benefit from the exchange.

Title: How to Generate Demand with Nokia Marketing Campaigns
Description: Attend this session to learn more about our Marketing campaigns for partners designed to help create demand, generate sales leads and realize revenue potential. Campaigns for DataCenter Interconnect, Passive Optical LAN, and Airscale Wi-Fi will be featured, along with the tools to simplify co-marketing campaign execution.

New IP, Optical, and SDN Products

Title: DCI Overview and a Special DCI Configuration Tool
Description: Tim Drake will review the 1830 PSS Datacenter Interconnect portfolio and provide a tutorial on the DCI Configuration Tool. This DCI Configuration Tool allows you to build a simple point-to-point configuration that can even be done in a meeting with a customer.

Title: Service Desk Clerk Module
Description:
This module is designed to help in Nokia Customer Service Desk interactions with Nokia customers requesting Maintenance support.

This course covers the importance of the Service Desk Clerk, identifies the benefits a Service Desk brings to customers, and explains what the in house Technical Support resources will need to resolve customer tickets.

Title: Community Broadband
Description: As the world is rapidly moving towards Ultra-broadband, it is essential to ensure that no one is left behind. Community Broadband initiatives are playing a key role in accelerating the availability of broadband services outside of major metropolitan areas. Join this webcast to hear how Nokia provides all the building blocks that you will need to sell into communities wanting to build a high capacity broadband network that will be attractive for both businesses and citizens for decades to come.

Title: Generate New Revenue with you customers with Performance Reporting
Nokia Learning Hub
Description: PUTP Presents The Nokia Learning Hub

Title: Partner Marketing Manager
Description: This is Partner Marketing Manager curriculum is part of the Global Partner Program.

Title: Selling to Highway Agencies and Departments of Transportation| GP00601-W-1710
Description: By attending this training you will understand the challenges of highway operations that highway agencies and departments of transportation face every day, and you will also understand the according requirements for their communications infrastructure. You will learn how to identify target customers and how to engage with them. You will understand the Nokia value proposition including value drivers and key competitive differentiators; and you will understand the Nokia portfolio for intelligent highways. You will also get an introduction to selected reference cases and you will know where to find further information for your engagements with customers.
